      <description><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/13/wired-awake-13-may" title="WIRED Awake: 10 must-read articles for 13 May"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x413/s_v/speech-bubbles.jpg" alt="" border="0"/></a><br/><p dir="ltr">Your WIRED.co.uk daily briefing.Â Today, Google has released its language parsing neural neural net as open source, Facebook has clarified the guidelines its Trending News service operates under in the face of accusations of bias and deception, Nasa satellite data provides new insights into the mysterious phenomenon of magnetic reconnection and more.</p><p>By: WIRED.co.uk, </p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/13/wired-awake-13-may" title="WIRED Awake: 10 must-read articles for 13 May">Continue reading...</a></description>
      <guid>http://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2016-05/13/wired-awake-13-may</guid>
      <link>http://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2016-05/13/wired-awake-13-may</link>
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 07:40:00 +0100</pubDate>
      <title>WIRED Awake: 10 must-read articles for 13 May</title>
      <dc:creator>WIRED.co.uk</dc:creator>
    </item>
    <item>
      <description><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/12/activision-blizzard-esports-mlg-gaming" title="Activision Blizzard overhauls MLG.tv esports platform"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x413/a_c/2esports.jpg" alt="" border="0"/></a><br/><p><span>Dubbed 'Enhanced Viewing Experience', the platform will combine high-definition streams of gaming tournaments with match statistics, leaderboards and other in-game insights.</span></p><p>By: Matthew Reynolds, </p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/12/activision-blizzard-esports-mlg-gaming" title="Activision Blizzard overhauls MLG.tv esports platform">Continue reading...</a></description>
      <guid>http://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2016-05/12/activision-blizzard-esports-mlg-gaming</guid>
      <link>http://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2016-05/12/activision-blizzard-esports-mlg-gaming</link>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 15:12:00 +0100</pubDate>
      <title>Activision Blizzard overhauls MLG.tv esports platform</title>
      <dc:creator>Matthew Reynolds</dc:creator>
    </item>
    <item>
      <description><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/12/what-is-the-weekend-effect-nhs-deaths" title="Weekend effect: do more people die in NHS hospitals at the weekend?"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x413/k_n/nhs6.jpg" alt="" border="0"/></a><br/><p>A newÂ studyÂ from the University of Oxford has suggested that the 'weekend effect' â the idea that patients admitted to hospital at the weekend are more likely to die â is actually the result of "the way medical records are coded for data returns". The as-yet unpublished studyÂ </p>
<p>It's just one of many studies examining the phenomena and asking whether or not the weekend effect is real.Â </p>
<p>Â </p><p>By: Emily Reynolds, </p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/12/what-is-the-weekend-effect-nhs-deaths" title="Weekend effect: do more people die in NHS hospitals at the weekend?">Continue reading...</a></description>
      <guid>http://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2016-05/12/what-is-the-weekend-effect-nhs-deaths</guid>
      <link>http://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2016-05/12/what-is-the-weekend-effect-nhs-deaths</link>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:59:00 +0100</pubDate>
      <title>Do more people die in NHS hospitals at the weekend?</title>
      <dc:creator>Emily Reynolds</dc:creator>
    </item>
    <item>
      <description><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/12/bbc-charter-review-white-paper-what-will-change" title="BBC white paper: here's what the proposals mean for you"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x413/g_j/GettyImages-156325964.jpg" alt="" border="0"/></a><br/><p>The structure and working of the BBC will undergo a major transformation the government has said as it published its review of the organisation.</p><p>By: James Temperton and Matt Burgess, </p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/12/bbc-charter-review-white-paper-what-will-change" title="BBC white paper: here's what the proposals mean for you">Continue reading...</a></description>
      <guid>http://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2016-05/12/bbc-charter-review-white-paper-what-will-change</guid>
      <link>http://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2016-05/12/bbc-charter-review-white-paper-what-will-change</link>

    <item>
      <description><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/12/who-urban-air-pollution-worldwide" title="80% of city dwellers exposed to 'severe' air pollution"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x413/a_c/air%20pollution.jpg" alt="" border="0"/></a><br/><p>New air quality data from the WHO shows that 80 per cent of the world's city dwellers are exposed to dangerous levels of air pollution, with those in low- and middle-income countries particularly affected.</p><p>By: K.G Orphanides, </p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/12/who-urban-air-pollution-worldwide" title="80% of city dwellers exposed to 'severe' air pollution">Continue reading...</a></description>
      <guid>http://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2016-05/12/who-urban-air-pollution-worldwide</guid>
      <link>http://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2016-05/12/who-urban-air-pollution-worldwide</link>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 11:59:00 +0100</pubDate>

      <dc:creator>K.G Orphanides</dc:creator>
    </item>

      <description><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/12/bt-sport-free-champions-league-final-europa-league-final-youtube" title="BT Sport will stream Champions League final for free on YouTube"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x413/a_c/bt%20sport.jpg" alt="" border="0"/></a><br/><p class="p1">BT Sport announces both the Champions League and Europa League finals will be broadcast free of charge on YouTube.</p><p>By: Matt Burgess, </p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/12/bt-sport-free-champions-league-final-europa-league-final-youtube" title="BT Sport will stream Champions League final for free on YouTube">Continue reading...</a></description>

      <description><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/12/science-museum-rebuild-eric-uk-first-robot" title="How Eric, the UK's first robot, is being brought back to life"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x413/d_f/eric-robot-1366x576_1.jpg" alt="London Science museum Eric Robot" border="0"/></a><br/><p>First built in 1928, Eric could shoot sparks from his teeth, move and speak. Having since vanished, engineers are now trying to bring him back to life.</p><p>By: Lee Bell, </p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/12/science-museum-rebuild-eric-uk-first-robot" title="How Eric, the UK's first robot, is being brought back to life">Continue reading...</a></description>
      <guid>http://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2016-05/12/science-museum-rebuild-eric-uk-first-robot</guid>
      <link>http://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2016-05/12/science-museum-rebuild-eric-uk-first-robot</link>

      <description><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/12/hyperloop-one-first-test" title="Hyperloop One reaches 187kph in first test run"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x413/a_c/B-ROLL%20PACKAGE%20v3.00_03_28_12.Still005.jpg" alt="" border="0"/></a><br/><p>It's a small step towards the technology's theorised speeds of 745mph (1,200kph), or Hyperloop One'sÂ promisedÂ surface speeds in excess of 300m/s (1,080kph).</p><p>By: K.G Orphanides, </p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/12/hyperloop-one-first-test" title="Hyperloop One reaches 187kph in first test run">Continue reading...</a></description>

    <item>
      <description><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/12/google-translate-android-apps-ios-offline" title="Google Translate now works inside any Android app"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x413/g_j/Google-Translate-Tap-to-Translate-930x556.jpg" alt="" border="0"/></a><br/><p>Users of Google Translate onÂ AndroidÂ will now be able to use it within other text apps, just one feature in a raft of enhancements in the latest update of the app.</p><p>By: Emily Reynolds, </p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/12/google-translate-android-apps-ios-offline" title="Google Translate now works inside any Android app">Continue reading...</a></description>
      <guid>http://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2016-05/12/google-translate-android-apps-ios-offline</guid>

    <item>
      <description><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/12/google-adwords-banned-payday-loans-adverts" title="Google bans adverts from payday loan companies"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x413/g_j/GettyImages-486234008.jpg" alt="" border="0"/></a><br/><p>Google said adverts for payday loans where repayment was due within 60 days would no longer be allowed.</p><p>By: Matt Burgess, </p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/12/google-adwords-banned-payday-loans-adverts" title="Google bans adverts from payday loan companies">Continue reading...</a></description>

    <item>
      <description><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/12/wired-awake-12-may" title="WIRED Awake: 10 must-read articles for 12 May"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/1920x1280/g_j/GettyImages2-174351909.jpg#625462_Landscape_1-50_620_NOTFOUND" alt="" border="0"/></a><br/><p dir="ltr">Your WIRED.co.uk daily briefing.Â Today, Hyperloop One has successfully completed the first public test of its propulsion system, Google has banned ads from payday lenders, Boeing has announced that its Starliner won't be ready to take Nasa astronauts to the ISS until 2018 at earliest and more.</p><p>By: WIRED.co.uk, </p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/12/wired-awake-12-may" title="WIRED Awake: 10 must-read articles for 12 May">Continue reading...</a></description>

    <item>
      <description><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/civilization-vi-october-2016-release-date" title="Civilization VI gets October 2016 release date"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x413/a_c/CivilizationVI_screenshot_announce2.jpg" alt="" border="0"/></a><br/><br/><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/civilization-vi-october-2016-release-date/viewgallery#!image-number=2" title="Civilization VI gets October 2016 release date"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x620/a_c/Civ_VI_KeyArt.jpg" alt="" border="0"/></a>&nbsp;<a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/civilization-vi-october-2016-release-date/viewgallery#!image-number=3" title="Civilization VI gets October 2016 release date"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x620/a_c/CivilizationVI_screenshot_announce1.jpg" alt="" border="0"/></a>&nbsp;<a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/civilization-vi-october-2016-release-date/viewgallery#!image-number=4" title="Civilization VI gets October 2016 release date"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x620/a_c/CivilizationVI_screenshot_announce3.jpg" alt="" border="0"/></a>&nbsp;<p>Firaxis Games is marking the 25th anniversary of Sid Meier's Civilization with a brand new instalment for the historical strategy series.</p><p>By: Matt Kamen, </p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/civilization-vi-october-2016-release-date" title="Civilization VI gets October 2016 release date">Continue reading...</a></description>
      <guid>http://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2016-05/11/civilization-vi-october-2016-release-date</guid>

    </item>
    <item>
      <description><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/nintendo-smartphone-games-free-to-play" title="Animal Crossing and Fire Emblem will be free to play on mobile"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x413/a_c/Animal_Cropping.jpg" alt="" border="0"/></a><br/><p>Nintendo's Animal Crossing and Fire Emblem mobile games will be free-to-play, following in the footsteps of the popular Miitomo app.</p><p>By: Matt Kamen, </p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/nintendo-smartphone-games-free-to-play" title="Animal Crossing and Fire Emblem will be free to play on mobile">Continue reading...</a></description>

    <item>
      <description><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/france-periscope-suicide" title="Police investigating after girl broadcasts suicide on Periscope"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x413/k_n/mediabanner.jpg" alt="" border="0"/></a><br/><p><span>The 19-year-old girl spoke to the camera for an hour before killing herself.Â Some users appeared to be encouraging her.</span></p><p>By: Emily Reynolds, </p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/france-periscope-suicide" title="Police investigating after girl broadcasts suicide on Periscope">Continue reading...</a></description>

    <item>
      <description><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/nhs-deepmind-google-data-sharing" title="Should the NHS share patient data with Google's DeepMind?"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x413/k_n/nhs%20sign.jpg" alt="" border="0"/></a><br/><p>It's fundamental to healthcare that the person receiving treatment agrees to receive it. But is that the case with DeepMind's access to NHS patient data?</p><p>By: Subhajit Basu, </p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/nhs-deepmind-google-data-sharing" title="Should the NHS share patient data with Google's DeepMind?">Continue reading...</a></description>

      <description><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/windows-internet-explorer-outdated-quarter-of-users" title="A quarter of Windows PCs run dud versions of Internet Explorer"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x413/g_j/internet-explorer-11-logo_1.jpg" alt="Internet Explorer" border="0"/></a><br/><p><span>Users who continue to run outdated browsers were open to a "manifold" of threats, one security expert has warned.</span></p><p>By: Lee Bell, </p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/windows-internet-explorer-outdated-quarter-of-users" title="A quarter of Windows PCs run dud versions of Internet Explorer">Continue reading...</a></description>

      <description><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/google-cardboard-vr-headset-uk-launch" title="Google Cardboard launches in UK for Â£15"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x413/g_j/google%20cardboard.jpg" alt="" border="0"/></a><br/><p><span>It's taken almost two years for Google's low-cost VR headset to arrive in the UK, having launched in the US in June 2014.</span></p><p>By: Lee Bell, Edited by: Lee Bell</p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/google-cardboard-vr-headset-uk-launch" title="Google Cardboard launches in UK for Â£15">Continue reading...</a></description>

      <description><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/google-unicode-female-profession-emoji" title="Google wants better emoji representation for women"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x413/s_v/Screen%20Shot%202016-05-11%20at%2011.47.27_1.jpg" alt="" border="0"/></a><br/><p><span>A team from Google has submitted a proposal for 13 new emoji to "increase the representation of women in emoji".</span></p><p>By: Emily Reynolds, </p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/google-unicode-female-profession-emoji" title="Google wants better emoji representation for women">Continue reading...</a></description>

      <description><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/european-commission-three-o2-block-sale" title="EU blocks Three's Â£10.25bn takeover of O2"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x413/o_r/o2_1.jpg" alt="" border="0"/></a><br/><p>Mobile customers in the UK would have less choice and pay higher prices if the sale went ahead, according to the European Commission.</p><p>By: Matt Burgess, </p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/european-commission-three-o2-block-sale" title="EU blocks Three's Â£10.25bn takeover of O2">Continue reading...</a></description>

      <description><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/facebook-moments-facial-recognition-app" title="Facebook Moments photo-sharing app launches in Europe"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x413/d_f/facebookmoments.png" alt="" border="0"/></a><br/><p>Unlike Moments in the US, the European version of the app will not feature facial-recognition due to tighter privacy laws.</p><p>By: Emily Reynolds, </p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/facebook-moments-facial-recognition-app" title="Facebook Moments photo-sharing app launches in Europe">Continue reading...</a></description>

      <description><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/kepler-planets-new-exoplanets" title="Nasa's Kepler telescope just found 1,284 exoplanets"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x413/k_n/kepler_all-planets_may2016%20(1).jpg" alt="" border="0"/></a><br/><p>550 of the exoplanet discoveries could could be rocky planets similar to Earth</p><p>By: Matt Burgess, </p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/kepler-planets-new-exoplanets" title="Nasa's Kepler telescope just found 1,284 exoplanets">Continue reading...</a></description>

      <description><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/wired-awake-11-may" title="WIRED Awake: 10 must-read articles for 11 May"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x413/a_c/25255898046_bf32f5aa51_k%20(3).jpg" alt="" border="0"/></a><br/><p dir="ltr">Your WIRED.co.uk daily briefing.Â Today, new analysis of Kepler data has identified 1,284 new planets including nine within habitable zones, high-speed transport firm Hyperloop One is set to run the first live test of its prototype linear induction engine later today, Facebook has launched Moments photo sharing in Europe without its controversial face recognition feature and more.</p><p>By: WIRED.co.uk, </p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/11/wired-awake-11-may" title="WIRED Awake: 10 must-read articles for 11 May">Continue reading...</a></description>

      <description><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/10/hyperloop-one-rebrands-announces-test" title="Hyperloop race hots up ahead of first live test"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x413/s_v/Sunset%20in%20paradiseWHITE%20.jpg" alt="" border="0"/></a><br/><p class="p1"><span class="s1">The race to build the Hyperloop â the tube-based high-speed transport system originally proposed by Elon Musk back in 2013 âÂ just got more interesting.Â </span></p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1">Hyperloop Technologies, one of two Los Angeles-based companies competing to build a working version of Muskâs design, has announced $80million in series B funding and a series of high-profile partnerships ahead of the first public demonstration of its propulsion system in Nevada tomorrow.Â </span></p><p>By: Oliver Franklin-Wallis, </p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/10/hyperloop-one-rebrands-announces-test" title="Hyperloop race hots up ahead of first live test">Continue reading...</a></description>

It will also close down the game's developer, Avalanche Software.</p><p>By: Matt Kamen, </p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/10/disney-infinity-cancelled" title="Disney Infinity cancelled as Disney closes developer">Continue reading...</a></description>

      <description><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/10/smartphone-decrease-attention-increase-hyperactivity" title="Phone notifications cause 'ADHD-like symptoms'"><img src="http://cdni.wired.co.uk/620x413/k_n/notification.jpg" alt="" border="0"/></a><br/><p>A study has found that when people have notifications turned on they reported "more symptoms of inattention and hyperactivity" than when their phones were on silent.</p><p>By: Emily Reynolds, </p><a href="/news/archive/2016-05/10/smartphone-decrease-attention-increase-hyperactivity" title="Phone notifications cause 'ADHD-like symptoms'">Continue reading...</a></description>
